description_long.content: Tahko Golf Club is located in the heart of the Tahko tourist area, in the middle of the beautiful Finnish Lakeland. The club has two 18-hole courses, Old Course and New Course, and a 9-hole par-3 course.

The Old Course, completed in 2000, is the work of Swedish golf course architect Jan Sederholm, who has designed numerous courses around the world over the decades. Known for his respect for the natural landscape, Sederholm designs courses that blend seamlessly with the terrain rather than altering it. The Old Course is a prime example of his philosophy, where the layout is carefully crafted to follow the natural contours of the land, offering a challenging yet harmonious golfing experience.

The 18-hole Old Course at Tahko, along with its practice areas, is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful and player-friendly golf courses in Finland. The Tahko Old Course is famous for its stunning lakeside holes, offering breathtaking views of Lake Syväri and the nearby ski slopes. The golf center is highly versatile and well-suited for visiting players, as all the services a golfing vacationer might need are within walking distance of the course.

The golf course, completed in 2000, features several holes situated right along the shores of Lake Syväri, adding an exciting element to the game. The first nine holes are played in varied terrain with a mix of trees, park-like areas, and water features. After a refreshing break at the golf club, the back nine offers a fair amount of elevation changes, plenty of shoreline, and more stunning views of the lake and ski slopes. The round concludes at the golf club, where you’ll find a restaurant, sauna, and club services.

descriptions_fi.description: Suora ja pitkä avaus tai rohkeasti vasemman puuston yli / läpi. Suoralla lyönnillä veteen on matkaa 245 m. tavoitella greeniä kahdella pitkällä lyönnillä. Reilun 220 m avauksen jälkeen, pitkä rauta tai pieni puu ja reilusti vedestä vasemmalle kohti bunkkereita. Lähestymislyönti pitkähkölle greenille, jossa bunkkerit etuvasemmalla, kumpuja ja istutuksia oikealla. Greeni keskeltä reunoille kalteva, kumpareiden ympäröimä.

Varma avaus keskipitkällä raudalla keskelle väylää 150-170 m. Huomioikaa, että n. 100:sta metristä näkee hyvin greenin. Pitkä- ja tarkkalyöntiset voivat tavoitella avauslyönnillä greeniä. Oikealla puita ja out, vasemmalla tiheää metsää. Reilun 160 m avauksen jälkeen, kapeahkolle greenille korkea lähestymislyönti lyhyellä raudalla. Greenin takana syvä bunkkeri ja edessä pieniä kumpuja. Greeni voimakkaasti kalteva.

Avaus keskelle tai lievästi väylän vasempaan reunaan, metsä vaanii oikealla. Puusto pysäyttää lyhyet ja liikaa oikealle avautuvat lyönnit. Lähestymislyönti 80-120 metristä lievään ylämäkeen, matala bunkkeri välittömästi greenin vasemmalla puolella. Greeni on lievästi kalteva, mutta suuri, näyttävien kumpujen ympäröimänä.

Suora keskipitkä rautalyönti löytää greenin. Oikealla bunkkerit ja vesi. Vasemmalla ojat ja puusto. Suuri kaksitasoinen greeni tekee pitkät putit erittäin vaikeiksi. Greeni viettää voimakkaasti. Alamäkiputti saa kokeneemmankin pelaajan varovaiseksi.

Avaus suoraan keskelle väylää mahdollisimman pitkälle. Vasemmalla on tiheää metsää ja metsän keskellä lampi. (sivuvesieste) Oikealla harvaa puustoa, oja sekä huoltotie. N. 110-150 metrin lyönti pitää suunnata greenin etuoikealla olevan puun ohi ja greenin edessä olevan bunkkerin yli. Kaksitasoinen, pieni ja joka paikasta hieman kallellaan oleva erittäin vaikea greeni.

Ihanne lyönti on pieni draw kohti edessä näkyviä puita. Lyhyt lyönti jää pieneen ylämäkeen, jolloin jatkolyöntiä saattaa häiritä vasemmalla raffissa olevat puut. Pitkä lyönti antaa mahdollisuuden tavoitella greeniä kahdella lyönnillä. Matkaa onnistuneen avauksen jälkeen 230-250m. Oikealla lampi, bunkkereita etuoikealla. Vasemmalla puustoa. Avaus ja keskipitkä välilyönti. Lähestymislyönti isolle greenille. Oikealla bunkkereita. Vasemmalle rinne, josta pallot valuvat alamäkeen greenille. Greenin takana pensaita ja vaikea raffi. Greeni iso ja melko tasainen. Lähestyttäessä greenin vasen reuna kummun takana.

Pitkä alaspäin suuntautuva lyönti, matkaa noin 200 metriä. Syväri vasemmalla ja bunkkeri järven ja greenin välissä. Greenin takana kumpu. Oikealla harvaa puustoa ja oja. Sydämen muotoinen greeni viettää aika jyrkästi alaspäin kohti etureunaa. Avaus mielummin green eteen kuin greenin taakse kummulle.

Pitkä avauslyönti oikealla edessä olevan niemekkeen yli väylälle. Vasemmalla on out ja oikealla rinteessä puustoa, väylän oikeasta reunasta lähestymislyöntiä häiritsee puut ja greenin edessä olevat bunkkerit. Toinen lyönti jyrkkää ylämäkeen, matkaa noin 120-140 m. Greenin edessä oikealla ja vasemmalla bunkkerit. Leveä, mutta lyhyt kaksitasoinen greeni. Greeni viettää voimakkaasti kohti bunkkereita, keskeltä greeni jakautuu vasempaan yläosaan ja oikeaan alaosaan.

Avauslyönti vasemmalla olevien puiden oikealta puolelta väylälle. Vasemmalla tilaa, mutta väyläbunkkerit. 120-150 m. Kaksi bunkkeria greenin vasemmalla puolella edessä. Greeni on edestä alhaalla, mutta oikealla ja vasemmalla takana se nousee jyrkästi muodostaen kolme osaa. Lipunpaikasta riippuen lähestymislyönti kannattaa jättämään lipun alapuolelle.

Varma avaus männyn oikealta puolelta, veteen on matkaa 245 m. Pitkä avaus männyn vasemmalta puolelta puiden yli antaa mahdollisuuden tavoitella greeniä kahdella pitkällä lyönnillä. Reilun 220 m avauksen jälkeen, pitkä rauta tai pieni puu ja reilusti vedestä vasemmalle kohti bunkkereita. Lähestymislyönti pitkähkölle greenille, jossa bunkkerit etuvasemmalla, kumpuja ja istutuksia oikealla. Greeni keskeltä reunoille kalteva, kumpareiden ympäröimä.

Avaus pitkälle ja suoraan. Oikealla puustoa ja rinne, joka viettää kohti ojaa ja outtia. Vasemmalla tiheää metsää ja lampi. Ylämäkeen 110-150 metrin lyönti, jota vaikeuttaa vasemmalla greeni-bunkkeit sekä oikealla tiheä metsä ja vaikea raffi. Greenin takana ja takaoikealla jyrkkä rinne. Greeni voimakkaasti kallellaan rinteen mukaisesti.

120 metrin lyönti alamäkeen yli kauniin lahden, leveälle greenille. Vasemmalla on bunkkeri, jossa vanhahko mänty. Järveltä puhaltava tuuli vaikuttaa sijoittamista greenille. Greenin reunat viettävät poispäin ja koko greeni viettää kohti sen edessä olevaa järveä, greenin voimakas kallistus vaikeuttaa puttipeliä.

Avauslyönti kannattaa suunnata väylän vasempaan reunaan. Etuoikealle suuntautuvat pitkät lyönnit lipsuvat helposti veteen. Lähestymislyönti mielummin greenin eteen. Greenin takana vasemmalla on pitkä bunkkeri. Oikealla takana vaanii vaikea raffi ja vesi. Pitkä, kapea greeni, jossa lieviä kallistuksia, greenille pääsy vaatii tarkkuutta lähestymislyönniltä.

Väylä kaartuu hieman oikealle. Pitkä lyönti puiden väliin reilu 200 metriä valuu hyvin pitkin väylää. Vettä oikealla ja hoitamatonta metsää ja vaikea raffi vasemmalla. Ylösnousevalle greenille on matkaa 120-160 m. Vasemmalla puolella bunkkeri. Greeni avautuu nk. "saarelle", jota ympäröi Syväri-järvi. Greenin etureuna on alhaalla. Koko takaosa nousee ylemmäs ja takaosan keskellä on pieni kumpu, josta lähtevät mäet viettävät vasemmalle kohti bunkkeria ja oikealle pois greeniltä.

Avauslyönti suoraan eteenpäin tai hieman oikealle, mahdollisimman pitkälle. Vasemmalla on tiheä metsä. Hyväkään lyönti ei välttämättä riitä kukkulan päälle asti. Toinen lyönti keskiraudalla kohti huoltorakennusta. Oikealla greenin edessä on bunkkeri ja lampi. Lähestymislyönti 80-120 metristä greenin keskelle. Kaksiosainen, voimakkaasti kallistuva pienehkö greeni on kukkuloiden ympäröimä. Lähestymislyönti mielummin lipun ala- kuin yläpuolelle.

Greenin oikealla puolella on syvä bunkkeri ja koko oikea reunus viettää jyrkästi alas tielle. Vasemmassa reunassa taas on noin 5 metrin päässä greenin reunasta metsää. Väylä menee rotkomaisesti alas ja nousee jyrkästi ylös greenille. Greeni on kaksiosainen ja poikkeuksellinen, sillä etuosa on ylempänä kuin takaosa. Takaosaa ei näy tiiauspaikalta ja joskus on vaikea havaita onko lippu edessä vai takana.

Suoraviivainen par 4, jossa väylälle sijoitetulla avauksella pelaa itselleen loistavan birdie-paikan. Griini on verrattain suojaamaton, mutta lipunpaikasta riippuen griinin eteen sijoitettua bunkkeri kannattaa varoa ja sijoittaa lähestyminen griinin takaosaan.

Avaus edessä oikealla olevia puita kohti ja väylälle, oikealla oleva metsä vaatii lisälyöntejä. Pitkälyöntinen voi yrittää etuoikealla olevien puiden yli keskelle väylää, josta mahdollisuus hyvällä kakkoslyönnillä greenille. Puulla tai keskipitkällä/pitkällä raudalla suoraan eteenpäin, mieluummin hieman vasenta reunaa pitkin. Väylä laskee alas ja aukeaa hieman vasemmalle. Oikeassa reunassa on hankala raffi ja metsä. Lähestymislyönti 80-120 metriä, ylös nostetulle greenille. Takana hyvin vastaanottava kumpare ja Klubirakennus ja edessä bunkkereita. Leveä, mutta kapea greeni viettää aika jyrkästi joka paikasta vasemmalle. Etureunaan jäänyt pallo saattaa valua pois greeniltä.

descriptions.description: Straight and long drive or boldly over/through the trees on the left. With a straight shot, it's 245 m to the water. Aim for the green with two long shots. After a drive of about 220 m, use a long iron or a small wood and aim well left of the water towards the bunkers. Approach shot to a rather long green with bunkers on the front left, mounds, and plantings on the right. The green slopes from the center to the edges, surrounded by mounds.

A safe drive with a mid-iron to the middle of the fairway, 150-170 m. Note that from about 100 meters, the green is well visible. Long and accurate hitters can aim for the green with their tee shot. Trees and out of bounds on the right, dense forest on the left. After a drive of about 160 m, a high approach shot with a short iron to a narrow green. Deep bunker behind the green, small mounds in front. The green slopes sharply.

Drive to the middle or slightly to the left side of the fairway, with the forest lurking on the right. Trees will stop short and overly rightward drives. Approach shot from 80-120 meters slightly uphill, with a shallow bunker immediately to the left of the green. The green is slightly sloped but large, surrounded by impressive mounds.

A straight mid-iron shot finds the green. Bunkers and water on the right. Ditches and trees on the left. A large two-tiered green makes long putts very difficult. The green slopes sharply. A downhill putt will make even experienced players cautious.

Drive straight down the middle of the fairway as far as possible. Dense forest on the left, with a pond (lateral water hazard) in the middle of the forest. Sparse trees, a ditch, and a service road on the right. A 110-150 meter shot should be aimed past the tree on the front right of the green and over the bunker in front of the green. A two-tiered, small, and slightly sloped green that is very challenging from every direction.

An ideal shot is a small draw towards the visible trees ahead. A short shot will land on a slight uphill, where trees in the rough on the left may interfere with the next shot. A long shot offers a chance to reach the green in two. After a successful drive, there is 230-250m to go. Pond on the right, bunkers on the front right. Trees on the left. Drive and mid-iron approach. Approach shot to a large green. Bunkers on the right. On the left, a slope, where balls roll downhill to the green. Shrubs and difficult rough behind the green. The green is large and fairly flat. Approaching the left edge of the green is behind a mound.

Long downhill shot, about 200 meters. A deep pit on the left and a bunker between the lake and the green. A mound behind the green. Sparse trees and a ditch on the right. The heart-shaped green slopes steeply downward towards the front edge. Preferably aim the tee shot in front of the green rather than behind the mound.

Long tee shot over the headland on the right to the fairway. Out of bounds on the left and trees on the slope on the right, trees and bunkers in front of the green interfere with the approach shot from the right side of the fairway. The second shot is steeply uphill, about 120-140 m. Bunkers on the front right and left of the green. A wide but short two-tiered green. The green slopes sharply towards the bunkers, splitting from the center into a left upper and right lower part.

Tee shot from the right side of the trees on the left to the fairway. Space on the left, but fairway bunkers. 120-150 m. Two bunkers in front on the left side of the green. The green is low in front, but rises steeply on the right and left sides, forming three sections. Depending on the pin placement, the approach shot should aim to leave the ball below the pin.

Safe drive from the right side of the pine tree, 245 m to the water. A long drive from the left side of the pine tree over the trees allows a chance to reach the green with two long shots. After a drive of about 220 m, use a long iron or small wood and aim well left of the water towards the bunkers. Approach shot to a rather long green with bunkers on the front left, mounds, and plantings on the right. The green slopes from the center to the edges, surrounded by mounds.

Long and straight drive. Trees and a slope on the right that leads down to a ditch and out of bounds. Dense forest and a pond on the left. Uphill shot of 110-150 meters, complicated by green-side bunkers on the left and dense forest with difficult rough on the right. Steep slope behind and to the right of the green. The green slopes sharply according to the slope.

A 120-meter shot downhill over a beautiful bay to a wide green. A bunker on the left with an old pine tree. The wind from the lake affects positioning on the green. The edges of the green slope away, and the entire green slopes towards the lake in front, making putting difficult due to the strong slope.

The tee shot should be aimed at the left side of the fairway. Long shots heading towards the front right can easily slip into the water. Prefer to place the approach shot in front of the green. There is a long bunker behind the green on the left. Difficult rough and water lurking on the right behind. A long, narrow green with slight slopes, reaching the green requires precision with the approach shot.

The fairway curves slightly to the right. A long shot between the trees, about 200 meters, rolls well along the fairway. Water on the right and untended forest with difficult rough on the left. The uphill green is 120-160 m away. A bunker on the left side. The green opens up on a so-called 'island', surrounded by Lake Syväri. The front edge of the green is low. The entire back part rises higher, and in the middle of the back part is a small mound, with slopes leading left towards the bunker and right off the green.

Tee shot straight ahead or slightly right, as far as possible. Dense forest on the left. Even a good shot might not reach the top of the hill. The second shot with a mid-iron towards the maintenance building. Bunker and pond in front of the green on the right. Approach shot from 80-120 meters to the middle of the green. A two-part, strongly sloping small green is surrounded by hills. Prefer to leave the approach shot below rather than above the pin.

There is a deep bunker on the right side of the green, and the entire right edge slopes sharply down to the road. On the left edge, there is forest about 5 meters from the edge of the green. The fairway goes down into a ravine and then rises steeply to the green. The green is two-part and unusual, with the front part higher than the back part. The back part is not visible from the tee, and sometimes it is difficult to tell if the flag is in the front or back.

Straightforward par 4, where a well-placed drive on the fairway sets up an excellent birdie opportunity. The green is relatively unprotected, but depending on the pin position, it is advisable to avoid the bunker placed in front of the green and aim the approach shot to the back of the green.

Tee shot towards the trees on the right ahead and onto the fairway, the forest on the right requires additional shots. A long hitter can try to go over the trees on the front right to the middle of the fairway, from where a good second shot can reach the green. With a wood or mid/long iron straight ahead, preferably along the left edge. The fairway slopes down and opens slightly to the left. Difficult rough and forest on the right edge. Approach shot from 80-120 meters to a raised green. A well-receiving mound and clubhouse behind, bunkers in front. A wide but narrow green slopes steeply from all directions towards the left. A ball left on the front edge might roll off the green.

description_long.content: Tahko Golf Club is located in the heart of the Tahko tourist area, in the middle of the beautiful Finnish Lakeland. The club has two 18-hole courses, Old Course and New Course, and a 9-hole par-3 course.

The New Course, now known as the Lake & Forest Course, was opened in 2008 and reflects the distinctive style of Swedish golf course architect Jan Sederholm. With a career spanning decades and a portfolio of courses around the world, Sederholm is renowned for his approach of designing courses that respect the original shapes of the natural landscape.
The New Course continues this tradition, integrating seamlessly with the terrain and maintaining the high standard of design and quality seen in Sederholm’s earlier works, such as the Old Course.

This beautiful 18-hole track is located in the Golden Resort villa area near Lake Syväri, offering all the services a golfer could need, from extensive practice areas to a wide range of club services.

descriptions_fi.description: Kentän lyhin par 5. Vasemmalla vesi koko matkan ja oikealla tilaa. Aloituksessa lisää puristusta mailaan antaa tiiauspaikan välittömässä läheisyydessä oleva uuden ison klubin terassi. Griinin edessä kolmen bunkkerin vartio ja näin griinille on tultava ilmassa.

Ei pisin, mutta yksi kentän vaikeimmista väylistä HCP:llä 1. Huomaa valkean tiin avauspaikka :). Avauksessa on oltava tarkkana linjan kanssa, sillä vettä on vasemmalla koko matkan. Lähestyminen griinille, joka on kuin ylösalaisin oleva syvä lautanen. Griinin ympärykset viettävät voimakkaasti puroon. Griinin takaa löytyy kuitenkin tilaa.
Helpohko par 3, joka näkyy klubille kokonaisuudessaan. Ole tarkkana mailavalinnan kanssa, sillä griini on leveä mutta lyhyt, ja bunkkerit vartioivat edessä. Griini on tasainen ja siksi helppo putata.
Helpoimpia Par 4 väyliä. Tilaa on ja bunkkereita ei. Väylä on kallellaan vasemmalle veden suuntaan. Älä kuitenkaan eksy liikaa oikealle, sillä griini on lähestyttäessä kapea ja kalteva.

Dogleg oikealle. Malta pelata avaus mutkaan. Avauksessa vasemmalla vaanii vesi, mutta älä ahnehdi liikaa oikealle oikaisussa. Jatkolyönti väyläpuulla/hybridillä ylämäkeen, josta rautaa griinille. Selkeä lähipeliympäristö.
Loivasti kääntyvä par 4 oikealle. Avaus isoa mäntyä kohti. Griini aukeaa paremmin vasemmasta reunasta ja keskeltä. Lähestymisessä huomioitava bunkkerit edessä ja takana vasemmalla.

Mielenkiintoinen väylä, sillä avaus on selkeästi ylempää, sekä oikealla väylän lopussa on vesieste. Noin 200m avaus on turvallinen. Mitä pidemmälle lyöt sen kapeammaksi kurkku käy. Lähestyttäessä vesi vasemmalla, mutta muutoin selkeä lähipeliympäristö.

Hieno väylä kunhan saadaan kukkaistutukset ympärille loistoon, sillä bunkkereita ei tältä väylältä löydy. Tiiauspaikkoja on paljon ja avaus lyödään ylhäältä. Tiiauspaikalle avautuu hienosti edellinen väylä. Griini on vastaanottava ja leveä, mutta vaarallisen lyhyt. Vasemmalla edessä on puro, johon reunavallit viettävät voimakkaasti. Pelaa siis keskelle griiniä, ja vaikka löisit lyhyeksi, olet vielä kuivilla.

Tiukka mutta mahtava lopetus etuysille. Pohjoistuulen puhaltaessa kentän vaikein väylä. Tiiauspaikan vieressä puro lorisee kivasti mutta enteilevästi, sillä vesi saartaa lähes koko viimeisen väylän. Vettä löytyy oikealla puolella koko matkalta. ja lopussa myös vasemmalta. Muutamat bunkkerita vartioivat avausta ja lähestymistä. Lähestymistä kuitenkin helpottaa iso viheriö.

"Forest" käynnistyy helpohkolla loivasti vasemmalle kääntyvällä kentän lyhimmällä par-4 väylällä. Avauksella on paljon tilaa kunhan et ahnehdi liian pitkälle tai yritä oikaista liikaa vasemmalta puitten yli. Väylä kapenee kohti griiniä, jossa vasemmalla sijaitsevat bunkkerit ja oikealla kosteikko. Väylän vaikeus onkin lähestyminen, jossa on huomioitava korotettu griini, bunkkeri edessä ja vesi vasemmalla. Griini on helppo putata.

Avaus keskelle tai vasenta reunaa kohden. Bunkkeri ja veden nielu vaanivat oikealla 220m tiiltä. Pitkälyöntiset voivat koettaa nielun ylitystä 250m avauksillaan. Lähestyminen kumpujen ympäröimälle kapealle ja pitkulaiselle 2-taso griinille, jota vartioi tuplabunkkerit oikealla ja vasemmalla edessä.

Kentän pisin par 5. Tiukka väylä kiemurtelee loivaan vastamäkeen metsän keskellä kohti viheriötä. Avaus keskelle. Pyri pelaamaan jatkolyönti väylän vasempaan reunaan koska oikealla on puusaareke ja siellä piileksii vesi. Griini on kalteva ja kentän isoin joten pitkiä chippejä ja putteja on luvassa (3-puttia?). Luvassa kaunis mieltä rauhoittava siirtymä seuraavalle tiille.

Loivasti vasemmalle kääntyvä väylä pelataan sitten lievään alamäkeen. Lähestyminen pienehkölle 2-taso griinille jota vartioivat tuplabunkkerit oikealla. Lipulle lyötäessä melkoisen pienet pudotusalueet. Tällä griinillä pitää olla tarkkana puttien kanssa.
Ensimmäinen par 3 väylä takalenkillä. Virvoituspisteen jälkeen jopa kentän helpoin väylä. Metsän ympäröimä selkeä griini ja sen ympäristö. 3 bunkkeria oikealla pitävät pelaajan keskittyneenä.

Näyttävä ja samalla kentän pisin par 4 väylä. Avaus lyödään ylhäältä oikealle kallellaan olevalle väylälle. Pyri pelaamaan väylän vasenta reunaa sillä puut keskellä väylää saattavat olla herkkua silmille mutta myrkkyä väärille lähestymislinjoille. Oikealla on myös kaksi bunkkeria napsimassa vinoja avauksia. Griinin kupeessa koittaa jouluinen tunnelma. Kuusi on hauska ja erikoinen yksityiskohta griinin kupeessa.
Selkeän oloinen väylä, mutta avauksessa vasemmalla notkossa vaanii ryteikkö ja vesi. Pyri pelaamaan väylän oikeaa reunaa josta kapea ja korotettu griini aukeaa parhaiten.

Ja maisemia riittää. Tiiauspaikalta näet ison osan kentästä. Ehkä myös jonkun birdien sillä väylä on hcp 18. Helpohkon oloinen ylhäältä pelattava saarigriini voi olla myös petollinen. Joki tulee keräämään pallonsa sillä korkeuseroa riittää ja väylä on erityisen arka tuulikeleillä. Viheriö on myös kentän pienin. Vasemmalle jätetty levikettä vinoille lyönneille.

Tiukka väylä ja slaissarin painajainen sillä vesi oikealla saattaa pelaaja koko matkan. Lähde pelaamaan maltilla hyvälle lähestymispaikalle sillä väylän todelliset vaikeudet piilevät griinin läheisyydessä. Selkeä griini putata.

descriptions.description: The shortest par 5 on the course. Water on the left all the way, and space on the right. The pressure is on for the tee shot, as the new large clubhouse terrace is right next to the teeing area. The green is guarded by three bunkers in front, so the approach must be in the air.

Not the longest, but one of the most difficult holes on the course with HCP 1. Note the white tee's opening position :). The tee shot requires careful attention to the line, as there is water on the left all the way. The approach is to a green shaped like an upside-down deep plate. The surroundings of the green slope sharply towards a stream. However, there is some space behind the green.

A relatively easy par 3 that is fully visible from the clubhouse. Be careful with club selection, as the green is wide but short, and bunkers guard the front. The green is flat and therefore easy to putt on.

One of the easiest par 4 holes. There is plenty of space and no bunkers. The fairway slopes to the left towards the water. However, don't stray too far right, as the green is narrow and sloped when approached.

Dogleg to the right. Be patient and play the tee shot to the corner. Water lurks on the left on the tee shot, but don't be too greedy with cutting to the right. The next shot with a fairway wood/hybrid is uphill, followed by an iron to the green. A clear short game environment.
A gently turning par 4 to the right. Tee shot towards the big pine. The green opens up better from the left side and center. Take note of the bunkers in front and on the back left when approaching.

An interesting hole, as the tee shot is clearly from a higher elevation, and there is a water hazard at the end on the right. A 200m tee shot is safe. The further you hit, the narrower the neck becomes. When approaching, water on the left, but otherwise a clear short game environment.

A beautiful hole, especially when the flower plantings around it are in full bloom, as there are no bunkers on this hole. There are many teeing grounds, and the tee shot is hit from above. The previous hole opens up nicely from the tee. The green is receptive and wide but dangerously short. In front on the left is a stream, towards which the edges slope steeply. So aim for the middle of the green, and even if you come up short, you'll stay dry.

A tough but fantastic finish to the front nine. When the north wind blows, it is the most difficult hole on the course. A stream babbles nicely but ominously next to the tee, as water surrounds almost the entire final hole. Water is on the right side all the way, and also on the left towards the end. A few bunkers guard the tee shot and approach. However, the large green makes the approach easier.

"Forest" starts with a relatively easy, slightly left-turning, and the shortest par-4 hole on the course. There is plenty of space for the tee shot as long as you don't get too greedy or try to cut too much over the trees on the left. The fairway narrows towards the green, with bunkers on the left and a wetland on the right. The challenge of the hole lies in the approach, where you need to consider the elevated green, bunker in front, and water on the left. The green is easy to putt on.

Tee shot towards the middle or left side. A bunker and a water hazard lurk on the right 220m from the tee. Long hitters can try to clear the hazard with a 250m drive. Approach to a narrow and elongated two-tier green surrounded by mounds, guarded by double bunkers on the right and left front.

The longest par 5 on the course. A tight fairway winds gently uphill through the forest towards the green. Tee shot to the center. Try to play the next shot to the left side of the fairway, as there is a cluster of trees on the right, with water lurking there. The green is sloped and the largest on the course, so expect long chips and putts (3-putts?). A beautiful, calming transition to the next tee awaits.

A slightly left-turning fairway played on a slight downhill. Approach to a small two-tier green guarded by double bunkers on the right. Small landing areas when aiming for the pin. This green requires careful putting.

The first par 3 on the back nine. After the refreshment point, perhaps the easiest hole on the course. A clear green and its surroundings, surrounded by forest. Three bunkers on the right keep the player focused.

A spectacular and the longest par 4 on the course. The tee shot is hit from above onto a fairway sloping to the right. Try to play the left side of the fairway as the trees in the middle may be pleasing to the eyes but disastrous for incorrect approach lines. There are also two bunkers on the right to catch stray tee shots. A festive atmosphere awaits by the green, with a fun and unique spruce tree detail next to the green.
A seemingly straightforward hole, but a thicket and water lurk in the dip on the left from the tee. Try to play the right side of the fairway from where the narrow and elevated green opens up best.

And the scenery is abundant. From the tee, you can see a large part of the course. Perhaps even catch a birdie, as the hole is HCP 18. A seemingly easy island green hole played from above can also be treacherous. The river is ready to collect balls as there is a significant elevation change, and the hole is particularly sensitive to windy conditions. The green is also the smallest on the course. A leftward extension has been left for stray shots.

A tight hole and a slicer's nightmare as water on the right may accompany the player all the way. Play cautiously to a good approach position, as the real difficulties lie near the green. A clear green to putt on.

name: Penati Golf Legend
description_short: What sets apart the first of the two 18-hole courses, the Nicklaus Design LEGEND COURSE, are the wide, undulating fairways that offer players ample playing freedom, no out-of-bounds areas, sufficient privacy, and excellent visibility to the greens, all combined with the high, shaped "Nicklaus Design" sand bunkers and the challenging divergent terrain. The longest hole on this course measures 712 meters and has 11 tees. It plays as either a par 5 or par 6 and it also holds the title of the longest hole in Central Europe. It used to be the longest hole in all of Europe in the 2012 – 2019 period!

description_long.content: Penati Golf Resort is Slovakia’s largest golf course surrounded by the picturesque Little Carpathian Mountains in Záhorie less than an hour’s drive from Bratislava, and has been ranked among the best European courses by the World of Leading Golf and the World’s Premier Golf Destinations. Ever since it was established, Penati has been the most award-winning golf course in Slovakia, featured in many major rankings and reviews of courses by both golf professionals and ordinary golfers from Slovakia and around the world.

Opened in August 2012, the Penati Golf Resort is located near the town of Senica, about an hour’s drive north from the Slovak Republic’s capital, Bratislava, and it's now the country's largest golfing facility.

The resort is set within a generous 540-acre site, blessed with sandy ground and pine trees. It’s an ideal property for golf and Nicklaus Design snaffled nearly half of the available acreage to etch the first 18-holer at Penati, adding yet another new country to the Golden Bear’s flourishing collection of global golf destinations.

Boldly named Legend, this par 72 Nicklaus course measures a testy 6,954 yards from the tips, but you’ll need to bring your best ball striking game in order to tackle the monster par six 15th which can be stretched to a whopping 787 yards from the back tee. However, there are a staggering eleven tee boxes on this huge par six, so there’s a sensible option for golfers of all standards.

Some will dismiss the 15th as a gimmick, but nobody will forget the dramatic downhill par four closing hole which heads directly to the clubhouse terrace, where many golfers will be watching to see whether approach shots find a watery grave or the sanctuary of the island green.

In June 2013, Penati hosted the EGA European Mid-Amateur Championship and the Legend course impressed Bertrand Noël from France who won the gold medal, beating Australia’s Richard Heath at the third play-off hole. Albert Türklitz from Germany took bronze.
The Legend course has remained a premier layout in Slovakia and many have seen it on TV when the PGA European Challenge Tour visited Penati in 2014 and 2015.

descriptions.description: This opening hole is generous on the tee shot, but the closer you can hit the tee shot to the fairway bunkers on the left, the better angle you will have into the green which is protected by a large bunker to the front right. The green is fairly gentle and perfect to warm up the putter.

The tee shot is uphill and the goal is to get the ball up to the high part of the fairway so you have a clear view for the second shot. The second landing area is guarded by 2 bunkers, but an opening is left between the bunkers in order to have a clear second shot towards the green. The green is guarded by a bunker to the left.

Even though short on the scorecard, this hole can play very long against the wind. The hole is framed by a waste bunker on the left and there a bunker to the right of the fairway and one to the front left. It is best to bring in the tee shot from the right and the green is perched and proper shot placement will be a must.

This is the longest Par-4 on the course. The landing area is protected by bunkers on the inside left and the outside right. Clearing the bunkers on the left, will give a shorter second shot, but the center of the fairway is preferred for the better angle into the green for the second shot. The second shot is uphill and the green is protected with 2 bunkers short of the green and a deep bunker to the front right. The green has various plateaus and will provide some challenging putts.

Short uphill dogleg right par-4 and you should play the tee shot as close as possible to the tree line on the right in order to have the best angle for the second shot into the green. Important on the tee shot is to get the ball up the hill so you can view the green. The green is perched with a low area to the back right.

This is a long par-5, but playing downhill from the first landing area on. The tee shot is best played close to the right side fairway bunker. The second shot will require a bold decision whether or not to go for the green in 2 or lay-up the second shot for an approach 3rd shot into the green. The green is protected by a front and right bunker and the angle of approach is best from the right. Be careful hitting beyond the green as a deep bunker guards the back of the green also.

This strong hole requires a solid tee shot over the centre fairway bunker in order to take advantage of the bounce forward towards the green and leave a fairly easy second shot. Anything short or sideways off the center bunker will create for a partial blind shot towards the green. Second shot is best played from the left part off the fairway as the green is guarded by bunker on the right and the front.

The longest par-3 on the scorecard, but playing 15meters downhill. The green sits up perched and is guarded by a lake and green bunker at the front and a large low area behind the green. Anything outside off the green will provide for a very challenging approach shot and an equally challenging green with a low section running through the middle.

The lake should be avoided on the tee shot and it is preferred to keep the shot close to the fairway bunker on the right as the green is angled right to left and is easier to attack from the right part of the fairway. The green falls right to left and will create for some interesting putting.

With the lake in play along the right side of the hole, it is a must to keep the tee shot as far left as possible, which will also be rewarded by giving you the best angle into the green for the second shot. The green is guarded by the lake and a bunker to the right and the surface is very undulating, putting a premium on putting.

Shortest par-5 on the golf course, but against the wind, this hole will be a challenge. Important to get the tee shot up to the high part of the fairway in order to then have a good view towards the green. The green can be reached in 2 shots and needs to be attacked from the right hand side, using the slope that kicks in from right to left. The green is guarded by bunkers on the left.
Strong par-3 which is surrounded and protected by bunkers pretty much all around. When the wind comes into play, good shot placement will be a must in order to avoid a long challenging putt.

This strong hole doglegs left around the waste bunker on the inside left. Clearing the waste bunker will shorten the second shot into the green, but this elevated green is best attacked from the right. No bunkers around the green, but a large and deep low area guards the green at the front left.

This is the shortest par-4 on the course with an uphill tee shot. The front of the fairway is guarded by 2 "spectacle" bunkers and the line of play is just right of these bunkers. Only a short approach shot will be required, but accuracy will be a must in order to place the ball in the proper location on this undulating and rolling green.

The longest par-"5" on the course, if not in Europe. Two different tee areas have been set up depending on how the hole wants to be played for the day. The distance between both tee areas is the typical driver's distance, and this hole can be played as a par-5 or par-6. The fairway is split by a waster bunker on the tee shot and the second landing area is framed by a large waste bunker area to the left and protected by various fairway bunkers. This hole is not soon to be forgotten, not only because of its length, but also because of the stunning setting.

After the longest hole on the golf course, you now have the shortest golf hole, only measuring 151 meters. The hole plays downhill, which will make it even play shorter. The tees and green are separated by a large waste bunker and the green is best attacked from the left.

This hole with the elevated tees is bordered by water along the left side, but the water should not come into play on the tee shot. Fairway bunkers to the right can be cleared by a well executed tee shot, leaving only a short approach shot into the green. The green is protected by the lake on the left and the low area to the right and back of the green.

What a great way to finish a round of golf on this picturesque downhill par-4 with the island green. The tee shot is all about ball placement in order to setup the best angle and distance for the short second shot. The island green is angled left to right, has water all around and a green bunker to the front right. Again, don't be too aggressive on the tee shot, which will result in the best setup for the second shot hopefully resulting in a birdie on the last hole proudly looking at the people sitting at the club house behind the green.

description_long.content: Penati Golf Resort is Slovakia’s largest golf course surrounded by the picturesque Little Carpathian Mountains in Záhorie less than an hour’s drive from Bratislava, and has been ranked among the best European courses by the World of Leading Golf and the World’s Premier Golf Destinations. Ever since it was established, Penati has been the most award-winning golf course in Slovakia, featured in many major rankings and reviews of courses by both golf professionals and ordinary golfers from Slovakia and around the world.

Opened in August 2012, the Penati Golf Resort is located near the town of Senica, about an hour’s drive north from the Slovak Republic’s capital, Bratislava, and it's now the country's largest golfing facility.
Design of the second course – the Heritage - was entrusted to Jonathan Davison. The second eighteen holes in its high standard complement the Legend course, creating an attractive alternative.
The difference is a return to the roots and traditions of island-design courses, enhancing the views of the splendour and natural colours of the countryside abundant in this area.
World-renowned shaper Mick McShane was in charge of shaping the holes.  His signature is on such courses as Kingsbarnes and The Castle Course in the Home of Golf, St Andrews Links in Scotland.
The grand opening of the second 18-hole course Heritage took place in August 2013.

descriptions.description: Drive up the right side of the fairway for the easiest approach to attack the first green. Club selection is vital for your second shot to this small green.
Options are available from the tee. Long hitters can play up the right side to get close to the green. Play up the left side will leave an interesting shot over the water.
Drive up the left hand side of the fairway for the shortest route to this long par 5. You can be aggressive with shots into the green as the slopes will help run the ball to the pin.
A par 3 which will reward a left to right ball flight shot. Be careful with your club selection as trouble can be found for the long shot.
A long par 4 hole. The ideal shot from the tee is a right to left ball flight, this will leave a good approach to the narrow green. A four is a good score on this hole.
The green was designed to favour a tee shot up the right side of the fairway, any tee shots up the left will face a tricky shot over a deep bunker.
The draw shot is the perfect shot if you are looking a birdie on this short par 3 hole. Miss the green and the contours will leave you some interesting shots.
The fairway bunker will give you an ideal line on the 8th hole. Be careful on your second shot as water can be found with any shot not struck 100%.
Lots of options and decisions for the golfer. Play close to the fairway bunkers if you want to reach this short par 5 in two shots.
Play close to the fairway bunker to give you a perfect line into the green. The green is bigger than it looks so be aggressive with the approach shot.
An interesting par 5. Drive up the left side for the easier shot to the green. Carry the bunkers on your second shot and the contours will feed you close to the green.
The shortest hole on the golf course but not the easiest. Be bold with your tee shot as anything short and weak will find trouble.

An interesting par 4. The ideal shot will be a 3 wood or hybrid club down the left side, trouble can be found on the right side with 2 large bunkers. Play your second shot to the right side of the green and use the contours to run the ball down to the pin.

A long par 3 hole which will play shorter than it looks. The ideal shot should carry the bunkers short and feed to the green. Do not go long as you will be faced with a difficult pitch back up the green.

A big wide fairway is available on hole 15, play on the right side for an easier line to the green. Drives on the left side of the fairway will be faced with a difficult second shot across two deep bunkers.

A tough long par 4, the perfect tee shot will carry over the fairway bunker on the right side of the fairway. Take an extra club for your second shot as 2 large bunkers can be found short and right of the green.

A long par 5. Drive over the bunkers in the middle of the fairway to gain some extra distance from the downslope. The second shot is crucial, be careful of water and trees which can be found with a careless shot.
A right to left tee shot is the favoured shot on the finishing hole. Once in the fairway a bold shot will be required if you are searching for a birdie finish!

name: Porsche at Quellness Golf Resort
description_short: The Porsche Golf Course, which is directly opposite the Beckenbauer Golf Course, is the "little brother" of the European Tour championship course in sporting terms, and thus an ideal complement. The par 71 course was also designed by Germany’s world-class golfer Bernhard Langer and has comparable features, but was geared more towards the requirements of leisure-time golfers.

description_long.content: In sporting terms, the Porsche Golf Course, located right next to the Beckenbauer Golf Course, can be seen as the little brother of the European Tour proven championship course and is therefore a perfect addition. The design of the Par 71 course also comes from Germany's world-class golfer Bernhard Langer and has comparable features, but was more geared towards the needs of recreational players.

The terrain is flat, the 18 fairways lead through a mix of short and long holes through the floodplain of the small Rott river, which has also been integrated into the layout in some places. At 65 hectares, the area of the Porsche Golf Course is somewhat more compact than the Beckenbauer Golf Course, with its gently undulating fairways and mature old trees, it is also more visually pleasing than the more open neighbouring course.

Wider fairways, fewer troughs on the sides and relatively short courses make the Porsche Golf Course more pleasant and, overall, a little easier to play. However, the fair course, which is suitable for all handicap classes and is easy to walk, lacks nothing in terms of game technology and good fairways.

Hole 4 is particularly memorable, a long par 4 dogleg on the left of the river Rott with a difficult second shot on to the green, which is protected at the front by a small stream, hole 13 is also one to remember, a par 3 with peninsula green, and the strong finale of the holes 16 to 18, where water is a constant feature: Whether at the drive towards hole 16, a 90 degree dogleg around a pond, the teeshot on 17 on the green protected by the same pond or the approach to the final hole on a green with a pond in front.

name: Beckenbauer at Quellness Golf Resort
description_short: Venue of the PGA European Tour 2013-2017, the course was already awarded the "world class" rating in its opening year. The 18 holes don’t hold back when it comes to challenges, but also offer plenty of opportunities for that sweet feeling of success.

description_long.content: There are very few golf courses in Germany where a PGA European Tour professional tournament has been held. The Beckenbauer Golf Course in Penning belongs to this exclusive group of courses that meet the high quality standards required.

The 18-hole course designed by world-class golfer Bernhard Langer, played host to one of the most prestigious professional tournaments in Europe in 2015 and 2016, the Porsche European Open; in 2017 the Beckenbauer Golf Course was the venue for the Paul Lawrie Matchplay, in addition, the European Tour with its Challenge Tour was held here for three years in a row between 2013 to 2015. The best golfers in Europe praised the championship course on all occasions as being a demanding test at an international level, which impressed with its technical challenges and the excellent upkeep and maintenance.

The 18-hole par 72 course, named after football emperor Franz Beckenbauer, located in the immediate vicinity of the Porsche Golf Course, measures 6,500 meters from the champion tees and is the sporting figurehead of the golf resort. From the outset it was designed with the intention of being suitable for large championships, it is considered the most difficult course to play on the golf resort. The 18 fairway which are generously distributed over 80 hectares, lead in two varied 9-hole loops through the meadow landscape of the small river Rott.

The level, easy-to-walk course is characterised by a variety of water hazards. These come in the form of streams, ditches, troughs or ponds and force the player to be precise both when driving and when approaching. Water comes into play at 13 of the 18 holes, particularly spectacularly at holes 9 and 18, where a large pond gives the two greens an island character being separated from the water by stone walls.

The par 3 courses which are up to 200 meter long, the strategically placed bunkers and tricky doglegs give the Beckenbauer Golf Course its sporty character. The consistently first-class maintenance and upkeep is a real hallmark of the championship course: Even in mid-summer, the double-row irrigation system guarantees top-class golfing pleasure on the hand-mowed fairways and greens.

name: Villamartin Golf Club

contact.address: Avenida las Brisas 8, 03189 Orihuela Costa, Spain

description_short:
Villamartin hosted the 1994 Mediterranean Open which was won by Jose Maria Olazabal after an exciting play-off with Paul McGinley.

Villamartin Golf Course, designed by Paul Putman, is situated within a mile of the sea between Torrevieja and Murcia airport at San Javier on the south eastern tip of the Costa Blanca. The par for the course is 72 and it measures 6005 metres.

It is built on hilly ground with the front nine holes being at the highest point of the course offering some spectacular sea views. The second nine are situated more in valleys with brancas ( ravines ) coming into play on several holes.

description_long.content: Since 1972, the Villamartín golf course has been a benchmark in the courses of the Valencian Community. The design of Golf Villamartín is due to the work of John Puttman, who already carried out work on La Manga Club in the late 60s.

Vegetation with more than 50 years of history, beautiful views of the Mediterranean and generous greens that hosted a European circuit test in 1997. Severiano Ballesteros, José María Olazabal, Ian Woosnan, Sam Torrance and many other international golf figures have played and honored this great golf course with their presence.

The greens of Villamartín are internationally famous, with well-known holes, such as hole 17, a par 3 that requires you to cross a leafy, tree-lined boulevard to reach a huge and generous green with two platforms.
Villamartín Golf has an extensive community of players from all over Europe who chose this beautiful golf course as a place to live, with golf and this course being part of their lifestyle.
The Villamartín Club House , recently restored, has a wonderful restaurant with a high terrace that gives us great views of the 18th hole.
Villamartín Golf is, without a doubt, one of the best courses in the Valencian Community, as well as one of the deans of golf in the community.

descriptions.description: A winding dog-leg par 5 well protected by trees. Possible to reach in 2 after a long, straight drive. Green protected by 2 bunkers.
A long tight par 4 between a local road on one side and houses on the other. A tough hole.
An uphill par 4 with a blind drive and a drop down to the hole.Keep to the left on the drive.
A short tight par 4 with a lateral water hazard on the left which protects the line of the second shot.
A long uphill par 5 with houses on the left and lateral water hazards protecting the green on both sides. Take care for the upright stone after a good drive.
A spectacular par3 with a three tiered green protected by a front bunker. You look right down to the sea from this tee.
A short par 4 that falls down to the tree protected green after a right angled dog leg. Demanding second shot to the green for those with a short drive.
A blind uphill drive that then turns right to the green for the second shot. The dogleg on this par 4 is protected by a large tree and bunker. Keep left with your drive.
A short par 3 which is surrounded by trees. The tee shot is played over a pond and waterfall. Avoid drive to the left of the green.
A tight driving short par 4 where the green is protected behind and to the right by a tree lined ravine, and in front by a valley.
An undulating par 5 with a blind second/third shot to the green. A good birdie hole.
A long par 4 with a dip half way. Fairway bunkers before the dip.
A downhill 180-meter par 3. Protected by bunkers and a ravine in the back of the tee.

This hole has been described as one of the best par 5’s in Spain. It is protected laterally by a branca which works its way across the hole to give protection, with some trees, to the third shot to the green over some very high trees. Adventurous golfers may like to reach the green in 2.
A straight par 4. A water hazard to the right asks for drive in the middle of the fairway. The green protected by bunkers and 2 waters.
A long dog leg par 4 with a down hill approach to the green.

The signature hole for the course, often described as the best par 3 in Spain, is 210 meters from the elevated back tee and is all carry over a valley and branca to a three tiered green. The green is surrounded by trees and bunkers and the view from the tee is spectacular.

A tight driving hole, this dog legged par 4 is a fitting climax to an exciting round of golf. Positioned near to the clubhouse, it has a natural amphitheatre surrounding the green where spectators watch the final shots. Keep away from the drivingrange on the tee shot.

name: La Finca
description_short: Located on the Costa Blanca, in the south of the province of Alicante, and blessed with an exceptional climate, La Finca Resort is one of south-eastern Spain’s most iconic resorts, and a favourite haunt of golfing enthusiasts.

description_long.content: La Finca golf course opened its doors in August 2002. This magnificent golf course was designed by the renowned Spanish designer Pepe Gancedo, who was one of the standout amateur players in Spain.

This course has wide and generous fairways with spectacular and unique greens, enabling the golfer to use his driver, whatever the handicap of the player. The spectacular views all around this course makes it one of the best golf courses in Spain. We are particularly proud of our greens that add to the experience every golfer desires. All this make this course one of the best golf courses in Spain.

The greens at La Finca are totally different from each other, of varied shapes and singular beauty, some of them being famous: the 7th hole, is a square shape with large dimensions, resembles an English bowls green; and at hole 14, this is round and deep, reminiscent of the shape of a Chinese wok.

La Finca golf course has been the venue of several prestigious tournaments since its opening, such as: the Junior European Championship, the Spanish Junior Championship and the finals of Audi Class and Audi Quattro circuits, for amateur golfers. At a professional level, La Finca golf course has hosted qualifying for the EPD Tour as well as the Valencian Community professional circuit.

descriptions.description: This inviting hole is flanked by trees, demanding a straight drive to avoid the tree-studded wasteland on the right. A creek intersects the fairway, adding intrigue to shot selection. The expansive green, free from bunkers, rewards a well-placed approach, though its gentle undulations could challenge the putting game.

This hole offers a gentle dogleg to the left with a fairway that narrows as you approach the green. Substantial tree clusters on both sides emphasize the need for a precise drive. A pair of flesh-colored wasteland patches are present on the fairway's edges, adding a strategic consideration to your shots. The green, sizable and welcoming, is situated at the end of the narrowing fairway, with a notable tree positioned to challenge the approach from the right. Players will need to navigate these elements carefully to set up a successful putt on a green that looks to be generous and receptive.

On this 168-meter par-3, players face a straightforward tee shot to an undulating green. The green is defended by wasteland areas to the left and right, which will challenge those who miss their mark. The approach is open, without any trees to impede the flight of the ball, allowing for a full view of the green from the tee. The putting surface features subtle breaks that require careful reading for a successful putt. Precision is key to navigating this hole effectively.

This hole features a stout green, closely guarded by five bunkers that create a formidable challenge around the perimeter. The fairway leading up to the green is relatively open, with a scattering of trees that shouldn't trouble a straight shot. However, errant shots risk landing in the surrounding wasteland, making for a difficult recovery. The green itself is broader than it is deep, requiring an accurate approach to secure a safe landing away from the sand hazards. The putting surface has gentle undulations that will test the golfer's reading of the green. Precision in the approach is paramount to navigate this strategic hole successfully.

This hole presents an exciting challenge with its island green surrounded by a water hazard. The fairway leads up to this pivotal point, offering a clear run for golfers to position their shot. The green itself is a true test of precision, with water threatening any misjudged strokes. Trees are scattered along the fairway's edges, ready to complicate the recovery for shots that drift. With no bunkers to contend with, the focus is entirely on avoiding the water and landing on the green, which will require a confident and well-executed approach. The putting surface features gentle undulations, rewarding those who manage to find the safety of the green amidst the surrounding water.

This distinctive hole is characterized by a prominent water hazard that sweeps alongside and in front of the green, creating a narrow passage to the putting surface. With a spacious green awaiting, the landing area is generous but demands accuracy due to the water's proximity. The absence of trees around the green allows for an unobstructed approach, but the pressure of the water hazard looms large. This hole is a true test of nerve and precision.

On this dogleg right, golfers must execute a long drive down the right to set up an advantageous approach while being mindful of the out-of-bounds territory hugging the far edge. The left presents its own peril with a water hazard ready to claim any shots straying too close. As the fairway bends away from the water, it leads to a spacious green, which is defended at the back by an L-shaped bunker. Precision off the tee is paramount to successfully navigate this hole, with a premium on placement and power to reach the green in regulation.

Navigating this hole requires strategic play as the fairway snakes towards a green that’s encircled by a water hazard on the right and a riverbed cutting across the fairway and to the left of the green. Aim right from the tee to avoid the wasteland on the left, leaving a comfortable approach to the green – hitting driver on this hole rarely pays off. The green itself offers ample space but demands skillful putting due to its surrounding hazards.

This hole unfolds with a long and inviting fairway, flanked by a peppering of trees that require accuracy off the tee. The drive must be well-calculated to avoid the strategically placed bunker in the middle of the fairway. While a stream meanders across, it’s well short of the driving range, posing little threat to the strong hitter. The approach is clear to a wide green, absent of water hazards, allowing golfers to focus on distance control and the bunkers lining the green when making their play. This hole is a good opportunity for birdie or even an eagle with a well-aimed second after a long drive.

This captivating hole offers a tantalizing opportunity for risk-takers—a drivable par-4 that beckons with promise. From the tee, golfers are greeted with a wide fairway that narrows as it approaches the green, presenting a strategic decision: play it safe or go for the green in one. To the left, bunkers stand as sentinels, while a wasteland to the right adds to the challenge. While not directly guarding the green, they still pose a threat to the ambitious golfer. The green itself is spacious, offering a chance for eagle or birdie for those who successfully navigate the risks. This hole rewards bold play and strategic thinking, making it a memorable feature of the course.

Tee off to master the art of accuracy over distance on this challenging par 5. The opening shot demands a cautious approach, avoiding the wasteland hugging both flanks of the fairway. Precision remains key and intelligent shot selection is paramount to set up a clear third shot to the green. Approaching the green, the player must negotiate strategically placed sand bunkers ready to capture any errant approaches. The green itself is a test of finesse, rewarding well-judged shots with a birdie opportunity, yet a careless play could quickly turn to a bogey or worse. Course management and a thoughtful approach play crucial roles on this hole, which favors the strategic golfer who respects the intricacies of the design.

Absence of water hazards invites a more aggressive drive to this fairway unfolding straight ahead, flanked by a natural rough dotted with trees. Two small bunkers lie in wait to challenge the accuracy of your drive, strategically placed to catch drives straying too far to the sides. Nearing the green, the absence of bunkers near the green allows for a variety of approach shots. The golfer can choose to run the ball onto the green or fly it in, depending on the conditions of the day and their own playing style. However, do not be lulled into complacency—the undulating green is well-protected by its contouring and the surrounding rough.

Step onto the tee of this mid-length par 3 where the depth of the green demands a keen eye and a confident swing. Directional precision is paramount as golfers must navigate a narrow landing area that stretches back, challenging both club selection and alignment. The green, while generous in depth, offers little room for lateral error. To the left, a solitary bunker lies in wait, ready to ensnare any shots that stray from the straight and narrow. The right side is lined with a dense stretch of woods, presenting a natural barrier that will severely penalize any shots that venture too far off course, especially those that carry beyond the green. This hole is a true test of accuracy and distance control, with the narrow green ensuring that only the most well-placed shots will find the safety of the putting surface. A successful tee shot here can set up a birdie chance, but any lapse in concentration can quickly lead to a challenging recovery.

This lengthy par 4 calls for a strong drive off the tee. The fairway stretches out generously before you, giving strong hitters a semi. The large bunker on the right poses no real danger unless you're afraid of the big dog. Beyond the bunker, the ample fairway tapers slightly as it approaches the green, demanding precision and strategic thinking from your shot selection. A deep bunker directly in front of the green offers a reminder of the need for accuracy as you navigate your approach, promising to challenge any approach shot that falls short. The green, set against a backdrop of verdant trees, rewards those who approach with care and precision. Given the length of the hole, securing a par here feels like a true accomplishment, while a birdie is a mark of exceptional play.

Off the tee, this par 4 encourages the bold to reach for the driver as an effective drive gains a significant advantage on the approach, leaving a mere wedge shot to the relatively open green. The cautious might opt for a fairway wood or a hybrid, however, seeking a safer route with a flight over the sand but staying clear of the narrowest section of the fairway spelling trouble. The green itself, long and slim, challenges players to execute a precise approach. It rewards shots that combine distance control with accuracy, making for a satisfying conclusion to a hole that tests every aspect of a golfer's game. On this hole, the right blend of daring and strategy off the tee can set up the chance for a score that feels like a triumph.

A tranquil yet testing par 3, this hole requires a shot of precise accuracy to navigate the natural water challenges. The stream's proximity to the green demands careful club selection and a steady hand, as any shots falling short risk a watery fate. The expansive water hazard to the right is equally unforgiving, ready to claim any shots straying too far from the path. Adding to the challenge, a large bunker awaits on the right side of the green, ready to test your sand play should your ball find its depths. The green itself is a bastion amidst the water, where landing safely feels like a true achievement. Directional accuracy is the premium here, with the hole leaving little room for error. A successful tee shot that finds the green promises a solid birdie opportunity, but the elements are aligned to punish the slightest miscalculation.

This shoe horn-shaped signature par 4, is a true test of skill and strategy. The hole is temptingly short enough for the green to be within reach for the big hitters, but such boldness comes with a high risk due to the required carry over the expansive body of water. The safe play starts with a hybrid or long iron to place the ball strategically in the fairway, avoiding the water that hugs the left side and the rough that bounds the right. This careful placement allows for a clear approach to the green. For the second shot, a mid iron is the club of choice for many, allowing for a controlled approach to a green that is designed to reward precision. With water waiting to claim any errant shots, the approach must be measured and precise. This devilish par 4 can be a maker or breaker, especially in competitive play. An honorable par here is a commendable score, often achieved by those who respect the hole's intricacies and play with a tactical mindset. A birdie is a feat for the skilled, achieved by those who blend power with precision to overcome the hole's challenging layout.

The closing hole is a long par 4 that concludes the round with a strategic quandary. From the tee, players face a choice: play aggressively, attempting to drive over the stream for a chance at birdie, or adopt a conservative approach, laying up before the water to set up a safer shot at par, albeit with bogey in the card being the most likely outcome. The fairway is free of bunkers, allowing a more liberal tee shot, but precision is still key due to the natural rough and trees that can penalize a wayward drive. The stream that crosses the fairway becomes the pivotal point of this hole, influencing the risk-reward decision for every golfer. Approaching the green, the challenge intensifies with bunkers guarding the left, right, and rear, demanding an accurate approach. The green itself is a test of finesse, rewarding those who navigate the approach with skill and precision. Securing a par on this hole is a solid achievement, while a closing birdie is a badge of honor, demonstrating a well-mastered round.

name: Adamstal - Championship
description_short: The "Championship Course" of the Adamstal golf club is quite sporty: the professionals of the European Challenge Tour, who made several guest appearances, were able to find that out. Thanks to up to five tees per hole, the course is still fair for golfers of all levels. Another plus: The "Championship Course" is fully e-car compatible – even a challenge should be a pleasure.

description_long.content: In the middle of the Lower Austrian Alpine foothills lies the Adamstal Golf Club, one of the most spectacular golf courses in Europe, grandiose in design and always immaculately maintained.

Designer Jeff Howes has succeeded in skillfully integrating streams and terrain levels, forest clearings and rock formations into the impressive landscape. The varied foothills of the Alps thus naturally determine the rhythm of the fairways and green landscapes.

Therefore, it comes as no surprise that the Adamstal Golf Club has already voted Austria's Golf Course of the Year six times by a jury of experts and recently voted one of the top two most popular golf courses in Europe for the fourth time in an online survey (Golf Guide Award). Adamstal has also been one of the leading golf courses since 2002.

Club president Franz Wittmann: "There is hardly a golf course like ours in Adamstal anywhere else in the world. Not only our international guests are impressed. A round at Adamstal is certainly a unique experience that you will never forget."

name: Diamond Country Club - Championship Course
description_short: Nothing is as precise as the knivesof our greenkeepers, who work daily to ensure maintenance and improvement of the heart of the resort – the 18-hole European Tour Diamond Course. They meticulously remove bushes and branches on and off the Fairways to facilitate precise shots – even from tougher spots. The short mown Rough, as well as the neat Greens, enable the best Golf, always accompanied by striking water hazards surrounding the centrally located 10-hectare lake. Enjoy the impressive Diamond Course and walk in the footsteps of European Tour professionals.

description_long.content: Designed by Englishman Jeremy Pern, who fashioned the exciting Dartmouth Country Club in Devon, the Diamond has very quickly established itself as one of the best courses in Austria.

With plenty of water to focus the mind, the Diamond opened for play in 2002 and it’s a mighty challenge which stretches out to 6,810 metres from the championship tips. Choose your tee carefully and avoid your macho instinct or you’ll be masochistic with your card.

After playing the first hole – with water running down the left side of the fairway – you could be forgiven for wondering over the next five holes what all the fuss is about in relation to water hazards here. Then you will discover that eight of the remaining twelve holes feature lakes and ponds which threaten tee shots, approach shots and, at some holes, both.

The two par three holes on the back nine – the 175-metre 11th and 145-metre 15th – are played to island greens where anything wayward off the tee will sink in the drink. The 418-metre, par four, closing hole has water on the left and out of bounds on the right of the fairway, so accuracy is called for right to the very last shot on the Diamond course.

Since 2010, the Austrian Open (badged the Lyoness Open from 2012 to 2017) has been staged on the Diamond course at Diamond Country Club. Spain’s José Manuel Lara won the 2010 event and saved his European Tour card in the process after beating David Lynn in a play-off.

Fast-forward to 2018 and Diamond Country Club will be remembered for genuine innovation. The Shot Clock Masters made history as the first tournament in professional golf to use a shot clock on every stroke as part of the European Tour’s bid to combat slow play. All players were timed on every shot, and on each occasion a player failed to hit his shot within the time limits, a one-shot penalty was added to his score for that hole. Interestingly, not one single professional ranked in the world top one hundred played in the 2018 event (which Finland’s Mikko Korhonen won) and only four players were penalised over the four days where round times were recorded as being significantly quicker than the season average.

name: Konopiště - d'Este
description_short: The d'Este course at Konopiště is a par-72 championship course that stretches up to 6,086 meters from the back tee. Located in the beautiful Czech countryside at the Konopiště golf resort, the D’ Este course is tougher than its sibling, Radecký, and requires skill and golf planning. The key is to stay on the fairways and off the rough – as several golfers have found that it can be quite treacherous.

description_long.content: Konopiště Golf Resort in Benešov, Czech Republic is an unparalleled experience. Not only is it a short distance from Prague, but it also offers two par 72 championship courses and a nine-hole academy course, making it the perfect choice for a golf trip. As couples, groups or for training stays.

The 4-star Manor Hotel at Konopiště Resort offers comfortable accommodation in the beautiful surroundings of the beautifully converted manor house. With roots dating back to the 14th century, this hotel has been beautifully remodeled and now has the facilities and amenities required of a good modern hotel, including satellite TV, safe, minibar, private bathroom and more.

The d'Este course at Konopiště is a par-72 championship course that stretches up to 6,086 meters from the back tee. The D’ Este course is tougher than its sibling, Radecký, and requires skill and golf planning. The key is to stay on the fairways and off the rough – as several golfers have found that it can be quite treacherous. While shorter than its bigger brother, D’Este is indeed not without its challenges; the fairways are narrowed in places by the property’s impressive forest, so it’s often wise to play conservatively to achieve a good position.

Simply walking in this magnificent setting is an experience in itself as the d’Este course is immersed in the surrounding nature, with several of its fairways lined by the park’s ancient oaks. The course’s highlight and certainly the most picturesque hole is the 9th, which features an island green accessible only by a narrow walkway.

name: Konopiště - Radecký
description_short: The Radecký course at Konopiště is an impressive course cut through a beautiful forest area. This championship course is up to 6,484 meters from the back tee. Named after the property’s original residents, Radecký was built in consultation with the European PGA and is a great test even for the low handicapper.
description_deste: D’Este Course The resort’s second course is called the d’Este Course, and although it is also a par-72, its length of 6,116 meters makes it a more manageable course for all skill levels. However, D’Este is not without its challenges; the fairways are narrowed in places by the property’s impressive forest, so it’s often wise to play conservatively to achieve a good position.

description_long.content: Konopiště Golf Resort in Benešov, Czech Republic is an unparalleled experience. Not only is it a short distance from Prague, but it also offers two par 72 championship courses and a nine-hole academy course, making it the perfect choice for a golf trip. As couples, groups or for training stays.

The 4-star Manor Hotel at Konopiště Resort offers comfortable accommodation in the beautiful surroundings of the beautifully converted manor house. With roots dating back to the 14th century, this hotel has been beautifully remodeled and now has the facilities and amenities required of a good modern hotel, including satellite TV, safe, minibar, private bathroom and more.

The Radecký course at Konopiště is an impressive course cut through a beautiful forest area. Designed by Keith Preston and named after the property’s original residents, Radecký was built in consultation with the European PGA and is a great test even for the low handicapper. The course was opened in 2002.

As a challenging par 72, the 18-hole Radecký plays up to an impressive 6,484 meters from the back tee for which the course has been rated as 75.6 with a slope rating of 147. The course features 4 sets of tees for different skill levels, however, offering the option of much more approachable distances off the tee.

Designed and built to blend seamlessly into the surrounding rolling landscape, Radecký's wooded scenery, ample bunkering, and water hazards give the course character and challenge. The large, contoured greens are renowned for their excellent condition and first-time players are known to gasp at the approach to the picturesque 18th green over a narrow bridge.

name: Sand Valley
description_short: Sand Valley’s Championship Course extends over 80 hectares of picturesque Polish country side. Rated by Golf World as TOP 100 Course in Europe it is the Home for the Lotos Polish Open of 2013 and 2014 (a Pro Golf Tour event). The resort offers a 18 hole championship course (par 72), 6 hole par 3 course, roofed 20 bay driving range and a large practice putting green.

description_long.content: Sand Valley’s Championship Course extends over 80 hectares of picturesque Polish country side. Rated by Golf World as TOP 100 Course in Europe it is the Home for the Lotos Polish Open of 2013 and 2014 (a Pro Golf Tour event). The resort offers a 18 hole championship course (par 72), 6 hole par 3 course, roofed 20 bay driving range and a large practice putting green.

Tilander-Ristola co-designed Inland Links layout offers wide rumbling fairways and challenging green sites that are the foundation for an exciting round of golf. Everything is tied together by the vast waste bunkers, clever routing and 18 memorable holes that all have their own story to tell.
